Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

Per l'headquarter di Milano ricerchiamo un/a:

                                                                                                   Data Analyst 

La risorsa, inserita all’interno del Dipartimento Corporate Product Master, si occuperà di coordinare e svolgere le attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate dell’area di competenza, in collaborazione con tutte le funzioni coinvolte. 

Principali attività:


Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto, creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso nel Gruppo.
Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:


Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilità a trasferte
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:


Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 


Innovazione e specializzazione 
Internazionalizzazione 
Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
Persone al centro
Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:


Formazione continua e sviluppo
Welfare aziendale
Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

                                                 MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura. La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.  (L. 903/77). 

Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com


Show more
HTML:
Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

Per l'headquarter di Milano ricerchiamo un/a:

                                                                                                   Data Analyst 

La risorsa, inserita all’interno del Dipartimento Corporate Product Master, si occuperà di coordinare e svolgere le attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate dell’area di competenza, in collaborazione con tutte le funzioni coinvolte. 

Principali attività:

  • Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto, creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso nel Gruppo.
  • Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
  • Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
  • Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
  • In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:
  • Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
  • Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
  • Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Disponibilità a trasferte
  • Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:
  • Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
  • Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 
  • Innovazione e specializzazione 
  • Internazionalizzazione 
  • Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
  • Persone al centro
  • Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:
  • Formazione continua e sviluppo
  • Welfare aziendale
  • Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
  • Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Quienes somos: Randstad Digital somos la empresa de consultoría tecnológica del grupo Randstad especializada en servicios tecnológicos estables. A nivel global estamos presente en más de 20 paises y contamos con más de 25.000 especialistas IT y a nivel nacional con más de 400 y tenemos oficinas en Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Sevilla, Zaragoza, Bilbao y Valladolid.

Llevamos a cabo servicios de IT e ingeniería apasionantes y con las últimas tecnologías. Cuidamos de nuestr@s trabajadores mediante el trato humano que nos caracteriza y por ello te impulsamos para seguir creciendo sin límites!




Nuestro objetivo: Crecer e impulsar junt@s en equipo el liderazgo digital para innovar y marcar la diferencia basándonos en la responsabilidad social tecnológica, conectando personas y tecnología.

Tus funciones: Si tu trayectoria profesional está orientada al desarrollo de aplicaciones java y cuentas con una sólida experiencia profesional ¡Queremos conocerte!




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Diseñar y desarrollar paneles en Power BI basados en los requisitos de los usuarios, asegurando precisión, relevancia y claridad visual.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de UX/UI para garantizar un diseño intuitivo y fácil de usar en todas las visualizaciones.
Coordinar y facilitar la entrega de los objetivos del proyecto, asegurando alineación con los plazos, expectativas de los interesados y metas comerciales.




Requisitos del puesto: Si te ves reflejad@, te animamos a asumir este reto.




3 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI. Experiencia demostrada en la creación de paneles, informes y visualizaciones de datos a nivel empresarial.
Experiencia en diseño UX/UI con enfoque en usabilidad, coherencia y alineación con la marca.
Gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicarse eficazmente con los interesados del negocio.
Se requiere certificación PL-300




VALORABLE: Conocimiento de Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Direct Lake, Dataflows Gen2) y certificación DP-600.




Tus beneficios: ¿A qué esperas para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo Randstad Digital?, aquí encontrarás motivos para ello:

PLAN DE FORMACIÓN CONTINUA, plan de formación anual, acceso a plataforma elearning de formación técnica, plataforma de formación en habilidades...
ACOMPAÑAMIENTO Y PLAN DE CARRERA, Tendrás un referente de Randstad Digital cerca de ti en todo momento.
CONCILIACIÓN, Sabemos que tu vida personal es tan importante como la profesional por eso podrás disfrutar de 23 días de vacaciones y en la mayoría de nuestros proyectos tendrás un horario flexible.
COMPROMISO y ESTABILIDAD, Incorporación a empresa en continuo crecimiento que apuesta por las nuevas tecnologías.
SALARIO COMPETITIVO acorde a tu experiencia profesional.
CONDICIONES contractuales competitivas, Plan de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante y cheques guardería) y Randstad Care, plataforma de ofertas y descuentos exclusivos.
PLAN TRÁETE UN AMIG@, si nos ayudas a incrementar el equipo, te premiaremos con una compensación económica.

Se garantiza la confidencialidad en el proceso de selección.

¿Tienes ganas y te ves preparado/a para asumir un nuevo reto como el nuestro?

¡Te estamos esperando! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJVLc3JtdsA

#somosRSC Randstad promueve la equidad de oportunidades laborales

a través de equipos diversos e inclusivos. Por ello, en nuestros

procesos, garantizamos la inserción de todas las personas

independientemente de su condición personal, género, orientación

sexual, etnia, cultura, edad, religión o discapacidad.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Sector: Fintech

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: €55,000 – €60,000 plus bonus, health and pension




Our Client

Our client is a Fintech with a strong international footprint and a reputation for delivering intelligent data solutions across the financial services sector. With a focus on innovation, cross-functional collaboration, and operational excellence, they are continually investing in their people and platforms to stay ahead of evolving market demands.




Why should you apply?

This opportunity offers the chance to join a high-performing data team at a critical time of platform enhancement and modernisation. The successful candidate will play a central role in developing high-impact datasets and dashboards that support strategic decision-making. You will gain exposure to leading-edge cloud technologies in a role that balances technical depth with business engagement. The company also promotes flexible work arrangements, excellent learning and development pathways, and a highly supportive team environment.




Who should apply?

This role is ideal for an experienced data professional looking to deepen their analytics expertise in a commercially impactful environment:

At least 3 years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
Proficient with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong SQL skills and exposure to Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with cloud-based data warehousing tools is advantageous.
Able to interpret data meaningfully and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.
Analytical thinker with strong organisational and prioritisation skills.




Role and Reporting Lines

You will report to a senior data leader within a structured analytics function that collaborates across business units. Core responsibilities will include:

Data Architecture – Assist in the design and maintenance of core datasets to support analytics needs.
Visualisation – Create clear, insightful dashboards and performance reports for various teams.
Insight Delivery – Identify trends and deliver actionable insights that guide business strategies.
Data Quality – Support the development of data quality frameworks and conduct regular audits.
Cross-functional Collaboration – Liaise with technology and operations teams to refine data sources and ensure alignment with business goals.
Best Practice – Contribute to the adoption of industry-leading analytics standards.
Training – Educate internal users on data literacy and the use of reporting tools.
Documentation – Maintain structured guidance on processes, governance, and technical configurations.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below.

Title: Data Analytics and Insights Analyst
Description:
DATA INSIGHTS and ANALYTICS ANALYST




PURPOSE OF THE JOB:




• Support with data and insights, align inputs to the Segmented Execution use case (products OOS, overstock, key challenges/opportunities)

• Support Data Analytics & AI Manager and colleagues on delivering updates and organizing communications to end users with involved stakeholders (mainly sales & TM)

• Reporting and Data Visualization & Dashboarding for cases (PowerBI based reports)

• Support data inventory and data managements processes (coordinating and archiving data mapping activities)

• Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)




SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:




• Management of data sources

• Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

• Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

• Ability to use and communicate data

• Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

• IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

• Analytical mindset

• Experience in analytics related departments

• Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

• MS Office – deep knowledge and experience




EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:




1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus




WHERE WILL YOU WORK




Sesto San Giovanni (MI)




DISCOVER WHO WE ARE




Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.




We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondovì, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.




Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.




Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.




AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY




At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.




Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.




Show more
HTML:
DATA INSIGHTS and ANALYTICS ANALYST


PURPOSE OF THE JOB:


• Support with data and insights, align inputs to the Segmented Execution use case (products OOS, overstock, key challenges/opportunities)

• Support Data Analytics & AI Manager and colleagues on delivering updates and organizing communications to end users with involved stakeholders (mainly sales & TM)

• Reporting and Data Visualization & Dashboarding for cases (PowerBI based reports)

• Support data inventory and data managements processes (coordinating and archiving data mapping activities)

• Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)


SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:


• Management of data sources

• Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

• Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

• Ability to use and communicate data

• Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

• IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

• Analytical mindset

• Experience in analytics related departments

• Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

• MS Office – deep knowledge and experience


EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:


1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus


WHERE WILL YOU WORK


Sesto San Giovanni (MI)


DISCOVER WHO WE ARE


Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.


We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondovì, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.


Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.


Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.


AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY


At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.


Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Scandit FINLAND




Imagine the what. Build the how.
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.




Your opportunity




As a Data Analyst in the Data Team, you will turn data into insights and support product managers, engineering teams, and other key stakeholders in decision-making based on data. You will also be heavily involved in the ShelfView product operations process as well as team internal reporting, KPI tracking, and data processing.





Analyse data and create visualizations in dashboards


Ingest, clean, and enhance static datasets like product catalogs


Drive on-off data handling needs and help to automate repetitive processes


Collaborate with other teams to turn data into knowledge and understanding





Who we look for





Degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field


2-3 years of work experience in Data Analysis.


Experience using Python to read, modify, and enhance data and use APIs to access production data


Curious mindset to explore hidden insights and work hands-on with data


Ability to start from a question and develop answers based on data


Familiarity with SQL queries, databases, and visualization tools (Looker Studio, PowerBI)


Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


Eligible to work in Poland or Finland





The good stuff
Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their careers at Scandit: 





An attractive individual equity plan in a high-growth company 


Smart, people-first culture


Flexible, office, hybrid, or home working


Innovation hackathons 


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Mentoring programs


Top-notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





 




We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in Switzerland, the UK, the USA, Poland, France and Italy and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK 




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. 




 




Imagine the What. Build the How.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed.




We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 4 anos de experiência em funções de Data Analyst;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de PowerBI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Business Insights

Dublin, Ireland or United States

6 months contract to hire




Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate Data Analyst to explore, analyze, report, and action on data from our portfolio of sports titles. We’re looking for someone who can translate product & business knowledge into deep analysis and, in turn, translate to actionable insights for cross functional business stakeholders. As you deliver valuable insights to stakeholders, you will aim to build strong relationships, become a trusted partner among business functions, and scale out team efforts from one team to the next. Our mission is to enable our partners to be more proactive, productive & successful by providing best in class, end-to-end and scalable data solutions.




The ideal candidate for this role has the ability to see the underlying story in the data and know how to ask the right questions. A solution-oriented and creative problem solver. A self-starter with the passion and enthusiasm to join a growing insights team to get results for meaningful change.




Job Responsibilities:

Leverage a deep understanding of how our titles’ game features & mechanics work and our business priorities to deliver actionable, business-impacting insights
Support business narratives and develop business cases, with effective data storytelling. Focus on using data and hypothesis driven decision-making to drive future growth and customer lifetime value
Learn different business teams’ and stakeholders’ ways of working and preferences for understanding data and be a bridge between the data team and business teams (Product, Marketing, Commercial) to translate complex business needs into data-related projects
Flexibly deliver different types of output to match stakeholder needs, including reports, visualizations, charts, and tables
Gain an understanding of internal titles outside of our portfolio to provide strong benchmarking and comparison points for business performance
Drive the exploration of creative new ways of measurement to identify patterns and causal relationships
Empower teams to track and analyze activity/productivity and support their research projects leading the efforts towards building scalable self-service tools
Data doesn't just appear overnight; we work with our stakeholders to understand what data matters most to their business and strategy. In addition to delivering insights on what is available to us, this role will be responsible for liaising with stakeholders to proactively identify what data we need to begin to record for future initiatives that drive value




Qualifications:

Track record of successfully delivering insights and analysis across business functions (Product, Commercial, Marketing)
Video games experience & passion - particularly in sports titles
Profound experience in data modeling
Profound knowledge in SQL and a data science language, such as Python or R
Great communication skills and a clear understanding of how to make insights understandable and actionable
High degree of proactiveness and curiosity to understand, measure and improve business operations through data
Ability to set a clear focus on priorities and execute on them effectively
Understanding internal customer satisfaction as one of your key success factors
Experience in data visualization tools, such as Tableau
Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

As a company at the forefront of digital transformation in financial institutions, Fenergo is revolutionizing the way client and regulatory technology is utilized in the industry. With a focus on providing Client Lifecycle Management (CLM) software solutions, Fenergo empowers financial institutions to deliver a faster, compliant, and digital customer experience.

With over 700 employees across 11 offices worldwide, Fenergo is a truly global company. This presents a unique opportunity for individuals who are ambitious and eager to make a significant impact in the financial services industry. Fenergo's impressive track record is reflected in their numerous accolades, including being recognized as the No. 1 CLM provider in RiskTech100™ and the winner of the Deloitte Best Managed Companies award. Furthermore, Fenergo's CEO, Marc Murphy, emphasizes the company's commitment to innovation and growth, making it an exciting place for talented individuals to contribute their skills and showcase their abilities.

What Will You Do?

You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining key dataset and models across the organisation which are driven from our cloud-based data lake infrastructure on AWS. You will work closely with a ringfenced team of system engineers, data analysts and a delivery manager to implement best practices for data management and contribute to the overall success of our data platform. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic individual with a strong analytical background who is passionate about working on innovative data projects.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analysing data from various sources
Support the creation of reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau
Demonstrate a strong willingness to develop technical and analytical skills on the job
Work with senior analysts to identify trends and generate actionable insights
Ensure accuracy in data collection, cleaning, and reporting tasks
Learn and apply SQL and Python for basic data analysis tasks
Clearly present simple insights and summaries to team members or stakeholders



Skills & Qualifications:


0-2 years of experience in a data-related role or internship
Familiarity with data tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or SQL
Strong attention to detail and a willingness to learn
Good communication and collaboration skills
A degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science)



Our promise to you

We are striving to become global leaders across all of the categories we operate in and as part of that we are a high-performing highly collaborative team that works cross functionally to accommodate our clients needs.

What we value is at the CORE of how we succeed:


Collaboration: Working together to achieve our best
Outcomes: Drive Success in every engagement
Respect: A collective feeling of inclusion and belonging
Excellence: Continuously raising the bar



Benefits

What's in it for you?


Healthcare cover through the VHI
Company pension contribution
Life assurance/ Income protection
23 days annual leave
3 company days
Annual bonus opportunity
Work From Home set-up allowance
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale for a world leader in Client Lifecycle Management
Other competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programs, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University'
Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress
Active sports and social club
State of the art offices in the heart of Dublin's Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area



Diversity, Equality, and Inclusivity

Fenergo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all employees are valued, respected, and can reach their full potential. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We believe that a diverse workforce enriches our company culture, fosters innovation, and contributes to our overall success. We strive to provide a fair and supportive environment for all employees, promoting equal opportunities for career development and advancement. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment opportunities and join our team in contributing to a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

  • Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
  • If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
  • We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover


#midsenior


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.




Your Contribution:

Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.




Your Skills:

2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Experience with SQL.
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Show more

Title: Alternance DATA Analyst D&I (H/F)
Description:
Alternance DATA Analyst D&I (H/F)




Description du poste

Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’analyse des performances, dynamique et prêt(e) à relever de nouveaux défis ? Vous recherchez un stage à impact et porteur de sens ? Le Retail et La Mode vous intéressent, ou vous attirent ! Cette opportunité est faite pour vous !




Où: 22 Rue Bergère 75009 Paris

Département : Ressources Humaines DATA – Diversité & Inclusion







Au sein du département RH - Diversité & Inclusion, en lien étroit avec l’équipe Data Analyse, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la mesure, l’analyse et le pilotage de nos actions en matière de D&I. Vous contribuerez activement aux projets en cours et au développement de nouvelles initiatives au sein de la filiale française.







Vos missions :

Collecter, structurer et analyser les données RH en lien avec la diversité - égalité professionnelle et dans le respect de la réglementation.
Produire des tableaux de bord et indicateurs pour suivre l’évolution de nos engagements D&I.
Concevoir et optimiser des outils d’aide à l’analyse sous Excel et Power BI, tout en réalisant des extractions de données à destination des différents départements.
Contribuer à l’identification des freins systémiques et des leviers d’action pour favoriser l’équité dans les processus RH (recrutement, promotion, rémunération, etc.).
Assurer la mise à jour des outils et garantir la fiabilité des données utilisées.
Effectuer une veille active sur les tendances en data visualisation et partager ces insights avec l’équipe Data pour optimiser nos analyses.







Profil recherché :

vous préparez un Master 2 en Data Science / Business Intelligence
Rigoureux(se) et organisé(e), vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et êtes capable de collaborer efficacement dans un environnement en constante évolution.
Vous maîtrisez Excel et possédez des connaissances sur Power BI.
Vous faites preuve d'une aisance tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit, et êtes capable de communiquer vos analyses et recommandations avec clarté et efficacité.
Curieux(se) et force de proposition, vous aimez prendre des initiatives et contribuer à l’amélioration continue des outils et méthodologies.







En tant qu’employeur, Zara offre à tous ses candidats les mêmes opportunités d’accès à l’emploi sans distinction de genre, d’ethnicité, de religion, d’orientation sexuelle, de statut social, de handicap et d’âge. Zara développe un environnement de travail inclusif qui reflète la diversité de ses clients dans ses équipes.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was born in 2014 as an IT Talent company, with the main mission of providing value through knowledge. We enable companies to face the challenges of the digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure Technological Capacity, Flexibility and Agility. In numbers, we are a team of +600 people with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madri.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, where we provide our customer with an extension of the IT teams in the technological aspects
DECSKILL BOOST, a specialised development to increase capacity and optimise Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to your needs, at the desired speed
DECSKILL CONNECT, where we provide our clients with consulting services, implementation and management of IT infrastructures




Our practice results in the creation of value for our clients, whether through the delivery of skilled and value-added services, skilled and motivated professionals, or through technology solutions that enable us to operate and transform our clients' businesses.




We are looking for a Data Analyst!!




👉 What will be your responsibilities?

Design and maintain data pipelines in Apache Airflow for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL).
Optimize code and SQL queries for performance and scalability.
Generate actionable insights by identifying trends, anomalies, and opportunities to enhance user experience and anticipate business needs.
Develop intuitive and informative data visualizations and reporting tools tailored to different stakeholders.
Collaborate with business teams to understand evolving requirements and assess the impact, feasibility, and cost of proposed solutions.
Ensure high standards in data ingestion, processing, and quality assurance.
Provide ongoing support and improvements to existing data solutions and tools.




📍Location: Lisbon




Do you want to know more?

send your CV in English to alexandre.cruz@decskill.com with reference “AC/DataAnalyst”




**Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all its talents. We capture and promote talent, from diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the person.

Title: ALTERNANCE | Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Position

Lorsque vous rejoignez Moët Hennessy (MH), vous entamez un parcours de carrière avec les leaders des vins, champagnes et spiritueux de luxe au sein du prestigieux groupe LVMH. Entrez dans un monde de possibilités, où les opportunités de développement de carrière à travers nos 27 Maisons, cinq régions mondiales et l'ensemble du groupe LVMH sont inégalées. Vous gérerez votre propre carrière au sein d'une main-d'œuvre passionnée et diversifiée qui s'étend sur quatre générations et combine une richesse de rôles et de compétences. L'esprit de conquête et le savoir-faire durable de nos fondateurs audacieux, passés et présents, libéreront votre créativité et vous inspireront à façonner le prochain chapitre de notre histoire intemporelle. En tant que membre de notre communauté engagée à travers le monde, et grâce aux engagements de notre programme mondial, Living Soils Living Together, vous nous aiderez à construire un héritage durable pour notre planète et pour les générations à venir.

Aux côtés de nos équipes dynamiques, vous donnerez vie aux valeurs uniques qui définissent notre parcours collectif : partage, élégance, épicurisme, intégrité et esprit de conquête.

Si vous souhaitez inspirer et être inspiré, créer des expériences et vivre le meilleur de l'artisanat, Moët Hennessy est l'endroit où vous vous épanouirez.

Job Responsibilities

Automatisation des Processus et Gestion de Projet :


Participer à l’extraction des données et l'automatisation des processus métiers liés au contrôle interne et à l’audit interne (Python, SQL, VBA, Power Automate etc.),
Travailler sur l’amélioration continue des pratiques du contrôle et audit interne en analysant les données disponibles pour identifier les tendances ou anomalies pertinentes,
Contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance des tableaux de bord Power BI pour les contrôleurs internes et auditeurs internes,
Participer à la gestion quotidienne des projets incluant la planification et le suivi des progrès via les outils de planification (ex. JIRA),
Préparer les supports de communication nécessaires pour les réunions de projet, tels que les slides PowerPoint, rapports d’avancement, comptes rendus, etc,
Assurer une communication fluide entre toutes les parties prenantes impliquées dans les missions d’audit interne et avec la communauté du Contrôle Interne,


Participer à la préparation des missions d'audit interne :


Extraction des données depuis SAP
Analyse et intégration des données dans nos rapports Power BI,
Contrôle de la cohérence des données,
Accompagnement des auditeurs dans la compréhension des données,
Participation à la réalisation des tests d’audit
Partage des conclusions avec toutes les parties prenantes (entités, maisons, etc.),
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit,


Audit IT :


Préparation des travaux d’audit IT (Demande de documents, préparation de fiches de tests, analyse des documents obtenues etc.)
Collecte, analyse et interprétation des données,
Réalisation d’échantillonnages et de tests,
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit


Profile

Formation & expérience :


École d'ingénieur en informatique ou Miage


Langues :


Français et Anglais


Compétences personnelles et interpersonnelles :


Bac+4/5
Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI
Connaissance des systèmes d’information (SAP est un plus)
Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus


Additional Information


Dates : A partir de Septembre/Octobre 2025
Lieu : Paris 7ème
Remboursement des transports à 75%
Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%

  • Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
  • Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI

  • Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
  • Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
  • Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡Hola! 🙋




¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.




Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.

Somos más de 3.500 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌

Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻




Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!!




🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia avanzada en SQL y Python en Barcelona con 4 años de experiencia. Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉




📋🖋️Habilidades y requisitos

Experiencia con SQL nivel avanzado
Experiencia con Python
Experiencia en cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)




🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.




En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.







Hablamos?




www.hiberus.com




#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE


Understand company requirements and define KPIs for dashboard development.
Collect, clean, and transform datasets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards for operational risk management.
Ensure agility in updating dashboards according to stakeholders' needs.
Continuously improve dashboard accuracy and usability by monitoring data quality.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Make recommendations to enhance dashboard production and data-driven decision-making.
Promote a data-driven culture within CIB by developing new data models.


YOUR PROFILE


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.Experience as a Data Analyst, specializing in dashboard development.
Proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, SQL, and ETL tools.
Experience with DataIKU.
Basic Python skills, preferably with Pandas.
Strong understanding of data visualization techniques.
Experience in Big Data technologies (PySpark, Presto, Airflow).
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX.
Familiarity with descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing.


What You'll Love About Working Here


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now! 


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







👋 Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. 🍽️

Combining cutting-edge technology 💻 with a deep passion for food and hospitality ❤️‍🔥, we’ve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 60,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ✨







🎯 About the role

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams—this might be your next role.







🛠️ Responsibilities

🔍 Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
📊 Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
📈 Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
🤝 Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
🧰 Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







✅ Requirements

🎓 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
💼 At least 2 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
🧠 Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
📈 Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude
🚀 Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
🌍 Fluency in English and Spanish
📊 Nice to have: Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI







Why choose us?

💼 Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
⚖️ Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
📚 Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
💰 Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
🌴 Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Arkadium our purpose is to have fun while creating fun - and that's exactly what we've been doing for 20 years. We're the creators behind the world's most-played games. From the Solitaire that came on your Windows machine, to hundreds of other games you've come to know and love - you can find our games on Arkadium.com, iOS, Android, and lots of other big sites worldwide.

As a proud Evergreen business our values of Fierce Drive, Positive Energy and Living Full Lives are the driving force behind how we run and the choices we make.

We're privately held (aka stable and reasonable about growth), founder-led (aka passionate about our craft) and we consistently rank as a "Best Place to Work" (aka not your typical games company).

Interested in becoming an Arkadian? We'd love to hear from you!

Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in connecting business strategy with data-driven insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Operations, to analyze key metrics, interpret trends, and develop actionable recommendations that drive business growth. Beyond technical skills, we seek a candidate who can bridge the gap between data and decision-making, ensuring that insights translate into impactful business strategies.

What You'll Do:


Conduct ad-hoc analyses using statistical methods to answer business-critical questions.
Interpret and translate data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Define and own data processes, from event tracking and data collection to building structured datasets and dashboards.
Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and other business units to identify data needs and align analytics efforts with company objectives.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through proactive auditing, validation, and monitoring.
Work with engineering and data teams to enhance data pipelines, implement tracking strategies, and optimize data models.



Requirements

What You Bring:


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with expertise in statistical methods and hypothesis testing.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a problem-solving mindset to drive data-backed decisions.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in web analytics and understanding of website performance metrics.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure).
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) for data visualization.
Hands-on experience with Databricks or other big data processing platforms.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and marketing analytics.



Benefits

Why Join Arkadium?


High-Impact Role - Work at the intersection of strategy, execution, and technology, influencing the company's trajectory.
Fast-Paced, High-Growth Environment - No two days are the same. You'll be challenged, stretched, and given autonomy to make an impact.
Leadership & Growth Opportunity - Manage a small but high-impact team and take ownership of critical company initiatives.
Collaborative, Agile Culture - We move fast, work hard, and have fun while doing it.
Shape the Future - Be part of a company that is redefining browser gaming and driving innovation in the space.



Benefits


Competitive compensation with structured performance and career development check-ins.
Meaningful health insurance.
Meal allowance.
Personal development budget to fuel your passions and desire to learn (Arkadians are taking classes in not only Excel and leadership, but also interior design and even swimming!)
Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
Professional Coaching Budget .
Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.


This role is open to candidates based in Portugal. Business hours are 9-18 WEST (UTC+1). For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.
Show more

  • Meaningful health insurance.
  • Meal allowance.

  • Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
  • Professional Coaching Budget .
  • Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
  • Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
  • A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.

For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CHI SIAMO

Edenred è leader nel settore degli employee benefit e offre alle aziende soluzioni digitali per migliorare la qualità di vita e il benessere delle persone che lavorano, dalla pausa pranzo, al tempo libero, fino alla cura della persona e alla mobilità sostenibile.

La nostra piattaforma digitale collega 60 milioni di utenti e oltre 2 milioni di affiliati in 45 Paesi attraverso circa 1 milione di aziende clienti. In Italia, l’ecosistema coinvolge oltre 2,5 milioni di beneficiari, 100 mila aziende clienti e 150 mila partner convenzionati.

Oggi il mondo è cambiato e noi ci impegniamo ad ideare soluzioni sempre più smart per supportare le funzioni HR e rispondere efficacemente alle esigenze correlate alle nuove abitudini lavorative.




“Enrich connections. For good.”, questo il purpose del Gruppo: sviluppare ed arricchire le connessioni per rafforzare le imprese e promuovere soluzioni inclusive, ponendo al centro non solo le persone, ma anche l’ambiente e il territorio.

Per noi, la diversità delle persone è un punto di forza e di ricchezza in grado di riflettere la diversità dei nostri clienti e stakeholder. Siamo inoltre impegnati nella protezione dell’ambiente, disegnando soluzioni spostenibili per la mobilità e lo spreco alimentare con l’impegno di raggiungere le zero emissioni nette entro il 2050.




Edenred è quotata alla Borsa Euronext di Parigi ed è inclusa nei seguenti indici: CAC 40, CAC 40 ESG, CAC Next 20, CAC Large 60, Euronext Tech Leaders, Euronext 100, FTSE4Good e MSCI Europe.

Vuoi sapere di più su di noi? Vai su https://www.edenred.it/




YOU WILL VIBE WITH US

La risorsa ricercata sarà inserita nel team di Business Intelligence & Customer Value Management, riportando direttamente al Head of BI & CVM, e lavorerà a stretto contatto con le diverse business unit.




Principali attività:

Analizzare, modellare e trasformare i dati per supportare le esigenze di reporting e analisi dei diversi stakeholder;
Garantire la qualità, consistenza e affidabilità dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business;
Data Storytelling: sintetizzare i dati, individuare insight rilevanti e presentarli in modo efficace e comprensibile;
Applicare le best practice di modellazione dati e di progettazione architetturale in ambito Business Intelligence.




WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU

Passione per il cliente, rispetto, immaginazione, semplicità e spirito imprenditoriale sono i valori che ricerchiamo nelle nostre persone. Se ti riconosci ed hai voglia di metterti in gioco in un ambiente stimolante e multinazionale inviaci la tua candidatura e diventa anche tu un* Edenreder !

Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria o comprovate competenze equivalenti;
Esperienza di 2 anni in ambito Analytics con tecnologie Microsoft;
Requisiti tecnici: Linguaggio SQL; Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service; DAX, Power Query (M); Utilizzo degli strumenti Microsoft Office 365, in particolare Excel; Concetti base di Data Warehousing (ETL, Stage, DWH) o Data Lakehousing (Medallion Architecture); Concetti base di Data Modeling: star/snowflake schema, relazioni tra tabelle di dimensioni e fatti, misure.




OTHER DETAILS

Contratto: tempo indeterminato
Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
Ticket Restaurant®
Piano Welfare
Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Show more
