La nostra piattaforma digitale collega 60 milioni di utenti e oltre 2 milioni di affiliati in 45 Paesi attraverso circa 1 milione di aziende clienti. In Italia, l’ecosistema coinvolge oltre 2,5 milioni di beneficiari, 100 mila aziende clienti e 150 mila partner convenzionati.

Oggi il mondo è cambiato e noi ci impegniamo ad ideare soluzioni sempre più smart per supportare le funzioni HR e rispondere efficacemente alle esigenze correlate alle nuove abitudini lavorative.


“Enrich connections. For good.”, questo il purpose del Gruppo: sviluppare ed arricchire le connessioni per rafforzare le imprese e promuovere soluzioni inclusive, ponendo al centro non solo le persone, ma anche l’ambiente e il territorio.

Per noi, la diversità delle persone è un punto di forza e di ricchezza in grado di riflettere la diversità dei nostri clienti e stakeholder. Siamo inoltre impegnati nella protezione dell’ambiente, disegnando soluzioni spostenibili per la mobilità e lo spreco alimentare con l’impegno di raggiungere le zero emissioni nette entro il 2050.


Edenred è quotata alla Borsa Euronext di Parigi ed è inclusa nei seguenti indici: CAC 40, CAC 40 ESG, CAC Next 20, CAC Large 60, Euronext Tech Leaders, Euronext 100, FTSE4Good e MSCI Europe.

Vuoi sapere di più su di noi? Vai su https://www.edenred.it/


YOU WILL VIBE WITH US

La risorsa ricercata sarà inserita nel team di Business Intelligence & Customer Value Management, riportando direttamente al Head of BI & CVM, e lavorerà a stretto contatto con le diverse business unit.


Principali attività:

  • Analizzare, modellare e trasformare i dati per supportare le esigenze di reporting e analisi dei diversi stakeholder;
  • Garantire la qualità, consistenza e affidabilità dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business;
  • Data Storytelling: sintetizzare i dati, individuare insight rilevanti e presentarli in modo efficace e comprensibile;
  • Applicare le best practice di modellazione dati e di progettazione architetturale in ambito Business Intelligence.


WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU

Passione per il cliente, rispetto, immaginazione, semplicità e spirito imprenditoriale sono i valori che ricerchiamo nelle nostre persone. Se ti riconosci ed hai voglia di metterti in gioco in un ambiente stimolante e multinazionale inviaci la tua candidatura e diventa anche tu un* Edenreder !

  • Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria o comprovate competenze equivalenti;
  • Esperienza di 2 anni in ambito Analytics con tecnologie Microsoft;
  • Requisiti tecnici: Linguaggio SQL; Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service; DAX, Power Query (M); Utilizzo degli strumenti Microsoft Office 365, in particolare Excel; Concetti base di Data Warehousing (ETL, Stage, DWH) o Data Lakehousing (Medallion Architecture); Concetti base di Data Modeling: star/snowflake schema, relazioni tra tabelle di dimensioni e fatti, misure.


OTHER DETAILS

  • Contratto: tempo indeterminato
  • Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
  • Ticket Restaurant®
  • Piano Welfare
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Title: Jr Data Analyst
HTML:
Siamo uno dei più grandi gruppi bancari privati ed indipendenti italiani che fonda le sue radici in una storia imprenditoriale lunga 450 anni e caratterizzata da innovazione e apertura. Stiamo lavorando per costruire l’ecosistema finanziario sostenibile del futuro con l’obiettivo di contribuire alle sfide personali e imprenditoriali dei nostri clienti.

Nel gruppo, Banca Sella è la banca commerciale, riconosciuta nel settore per le sue eccellenze nell’innovazione dei sistemi di pagamento, nel commercio elettronico e nel private banking e che fa dell’affidabilità delle proprie soluzioni digitali il suo principale punto di forza.

Come Jr Data Analyst, all’interno dell’ufficio Corporate Performance Management di Banca Sella, avrai l’opportunità di supportare i colleghi del team nella gestione dei processi di monitoraggio delle performance e di business intelligence, ricorrendo laddove necessario all’uso evoluto del dato sia in termini di tecniche di analisi sia in termini di rappresentazione con i software di riferimento.

Le tue principali responsabilità:

  • Interfaccia con il business per la raccolta dei requisiti e degli obiettivi (business understanding).
  • Estrazione di dati dai DB aziendali per la realizzazione di analisi a supporto delle funzioni di business e di strutture dati finalizzate alla predisposizione e automazione delle analisi.
  • Creazione di dashboard per la realizzazione di analisi e reportistica a supporto del business.
  • Preparazione di target e lancio di iniziative commerciali mediante la piattaforma di campaign management.
  • Valutazione delle performance delle iniziative commerciali e realizzazione di reportistica specifica.


Requisiti richiesti:

  • Hai conseguito una laurea in Informatica o Ingegneria Informatica/Gestionale, in Statistica o in Fisica, o Matematica.
  • Hai una reale passione per i dati che hai potuto mettere alla prova in un’esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni in società di consulenza o in ambito Tlc, Financial Service, IT, e-commerce nel medesimo ruolo ricercato.
  • Hai competenze di base relative a reporting e analisi quantitative su ingente mole di dati
  • Sai rappresentare in modo semplice ed efficace informazioni complesse (data visualization) riuscendo a relazionarti positivamente con interlocutori diversificati.
  • La capacità di lavorare in gruppo e la padronanza della lingua inglese completano il tuo profilo.
  • Hai una buona conoscenza di strumenti quali Excel, VBA, SQL, Python e PowerBI (o simili) e, come plus, una conoscenza del SW Board o di strumenti di Campaign Management.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Contratto a Tempo Indeterminato e CCNL del Credito;
  • Smart Working, coordinandoti con team e responsabile, potrai usufruire fino a un massimo di 13 giorni medi mensili da calcolare su base annua;
  • Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM;
  • Buono pasto da utilizzare nelle strutture convenzionate quali ad esempio locali, supermercati e altro ancora;
  • Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione;
  • Premio di risultato e welfare per il riconoscimento dei risultati conseguiti;
  • Permessi aggiuntivi, banca del tempo e altre agevolazioni previste dagli accordi integrativi per rispondere alle necessità e alle esigenze personali;
  • Vantaggi e agevolazioni grazie alle condizioni privilegiate sui servizi core del banking e assicurativi;
  • Sconti e convenzioni accessibili attraverso un portale dedicato;
  • Cultura organizzativa orientata all’innovazione e al miglioramento continuo in cui le opinioni e le proposte di tutti contano;
  • Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso uno sportello esterno di ascolto - anonimo e confidenziale – a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro familiari.


Modalità e sede di lavoro: ibrida con possibilità di smartworking e presenza fisica a Torino o a Biella.

Il Gruppo Sella promuove un ambiente di lavoro sostenibile, inclusivo e che abbraccia le diversità di genere, età, nazionalità, come occasione di continuo scambio culturale e fattore determinante per lo sviluppo stesso dell’ecosistema di Gruppo.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.




Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.




You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.




Why Working With Us?

Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.




Our Values

Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.




Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst (Tableau)
Description:
En VISEO Barcelona buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo de profesionales en el área de Data Analytics. Si te gustan los nuevos retos, y quieres progresar en tu carrera profesional con un Equipo de expertos con tecnologías a la última, únete al equipo VISEO en proyectos internacionales.

Tu Rol:


Formular y mantener paneles de control que automaticen informes.
Diseño y creación de aplicaciones internas utilizando Tableau, Python.
Big Data en entornos AWS.


Tu Perfil:


Experiencia de 2 o 3 años como Data Analyst utilizando Tableau como herramienta principal.
Experiencia con Python.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación para realizar toma de requisitos con clientes.
Dominio avanzando de Excel y SQL.
Nivel alto de inglés.


¿Qué podemos aportarte?


Oportunidad de incorporarte en una empresa pionera a nivel tecnológico.
Formación continua técnica y competencial.
Contrato Indefinido.
Beneficios Sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al remoto, ticket restaurant, transporte, 26 días de vacaciones al año etc.).
Conciliación familiar y laboral gracias a la flexibilidad y la posibilidad de teletrabajo.
Salario competitivo según la experiencia aportada.


Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:


Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Azerion

Azerion was founded in 2013 and is a technology company providing digital advertising and online gaming services headquartered in the Netherlands. Azerion operates a proprietary digital advertising platform focusing on both gaming and general (nongaming) content.

In recent years Azerion Group has expanded along the user engagement value chain to become a full stack provider of online digital advertising services, connecting advertisers with audiences through digital content (owned and third party) providers globally. The Group is involved in the provision of content-driven technology and data, serving consumers, advertisers, digital publishers, and game creators globally.

Our mission is to be the go-to-partner for advertisers for an easy to-use, competitively priced, brand-safe digital environment.

We are headquartered in Amsterdam and we have more than 1100 talented people of 55 nationalities working in 24 offices around Europe, with very diverse and multi-ethnic backgrounds.

For our Business Intelligence team at Azerion Head Quarters in Amsterdam we are looking for an Intern Data Analyst.

Team

The Business Intelligence team is an international, growing team within Azerion, with the mission of providing useful and actionable insights to our gaming/advertising products.

From importing the data, to processing it, analyzing it and exposing it to the users, we cover the whole data flow. Huge volumes of data, multiple sources and different analysis techniques are their own bread and butter.

We all are data enthusiasts with passion for our work, if that’s your dream job too, this is your chance!

What you will be doing and learning

The Data Analyst intern will work with gaming/advertising related data, with the main goal of deriving useful insights in order to enhance our products portfolio performance.

He/she will be collaborating with the other Data Analysts and with the Product Owners of the different products in the Azerion portfolio. No matter if it’s a casual or social game, mobile or desktop advertisement, there is always something hidden to find in our data.

Every day there is always a chance to learn something new while having fun!

Your Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Understanding stakeholder’s requirements and translating them into actionable reports/analysis
Communicating with live operations team / POs in order to assist them in making data driven decisions and adjusting their product update and promotion strategy
Taking an active role in the daily operations, responding to report performance and delivery issues
Developing both regular and ad-hoc reports
Maintaining, troubleshooting, and resolving issues/questions for report inventory
Supporting report environment best practices, coding standards, and look-and-feel
...and most important...having fun with data!


What you are able to bring to the table


Passion for the gaming/advertising industry
Passion for data
Strong analytical thinking and ability to solve problems
Proactive self-learner, able to adapt quickly to new technologies and solutions
Team and independent worker
Ability to work in a fast paced and active environment with evolving priorities
Ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work and learn at an innovative, high-paced company located near Amsterdam
An informal yet professional international working environment
Room for personal development in a highly skilled and motivated team
Hybrid work
Internship fee of €400,- per month
Lunch is provided for free
Weekly optional workout programs like kick boxing


Does this sound like that great internship you’re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form and attach your CV.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at

recruitment@azerion.com

Here’s what happens after you send your application

You’ll receive an email confirming our hiring department has received your application. An update will follow as to what the next stage will be for you.

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

People Analytics and Measurement is a team composed of over seventy data and analytics professionals who serve internal firm customers.

The Business Intelligence group is responsible for all reporting, performance metrics, and descriptive analytics enabling the firm to understand and optimize our people operations, and measure the impact of our strategic initiatives.

The team works in a highly collaborative environment, partnering with other teams to deliver meaningful innovation in people analytics.

Your Impact

As a People Analytics and Measurement Data Analyst, you will work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to extract, clean, and analyze the firm's people data.

You will develop fluency in the firm's people systems and combine this with your analytical knowledge to help translate business questions into rigorous analysis.

You will be responsible for supporting projects that examine the firm’s feedback and evaluation processes, headcount planning, staffing, feedback, surveys and organizational health and performance metrics.

You will communicate the results of the analysis to the team's internal clients, helping them understand the results and suggesting potential actions supported by the results.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's or graduate degree with focus or specialization in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, social science research, operations research, econometrics, or similar field
1+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics demonstrating success as an individual contributor within a broader team
Solid analytical and data management skills
Ability to plan, prioritize and manage multiple projects, and to work effectively under pressure and with shifting priorities
Flexibility in working style, eager to collaborate with a team (often virtually) and to engage in independent work, based on project and other circumstances
Ability to understand and communicate the meaning of analyses with individuals in a wide range of strategic and operational roles, in both written and oral form
Technical and analytic experience including experience with analytical tools and software such as R (preferred), Python, Tableau, Alteryx, or other programming experience
Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving data from relational databases
Exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify patterns
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, including manipulating large datasets
Intuitive understanding of what the analysis implies and how it would be affected by changes in assumptions
Comfort with dealing with ambiguity, making assumptions, and drawing conclusions
Substantial technical experience working with real-world data, including extracting it from production databases like Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake and cleaning it to create analytically tractable data sets
Familiarity with software development methodologies like Agile, including issue/workflow tracking tools like Jira and Trello and version control tools like git and GitHub
Familiarity with visualizing data using ggplot2, matplotlib, d3.js, Tableau, or similar software
Show more

Title: Junior - Public Business Transformation - NextHub Bari
Description:
Junior – Public Business Transformation - NextHub Bari

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Operation Excellence Public di NextHub di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Operation Excellence Public di NextHub si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti Public nell'individuazioni di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie. 

Your Role

Junior - La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Raccogliere ed analizzare i dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti;
Collaborare con il team di progetto in modo proattivo e collaborativo per il raggiungimento dell’obiettivo comune
Essere costantemente focalizzato sul risultato, sulla responsabilità individuale e sulla qualità del lavoro


Winning Requirements


Laurea Magistrale in materie economiche o ingegneria (completata oppure a 5/6 mesi dal conseguimento)
Eccellente percorso accademico
Forte propensione al settore Public e interesse per le nuove tecnologie


To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Operation Excellence Public di NextHub di Deloitte NextHub nella sede di Bari, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Operation Excellence Public di NextHub si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti Public nell'individuazioni di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie. 

Your Role

Junior - La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.

About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark.

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.

Responsibilities:


Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians.
Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date.
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards.
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems.
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency.


Key Competencies:


University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies.
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner.
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits.
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape.
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members.
Able to speak and communicate in English
Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications.


Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @ nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***Relocation opportunity to Germany***




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (Hybrid – 3 days a week)




We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join my client's dynamic Product team. In this role, you’ll analyze user behavior to generate insights, support A/B testing, and deliver actionable data to drive product enhancements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze user behavior to generate actionable product insights
Support A/B testing from setup to analysis
Monitor data to identify trends, anomalies, and test outcomes
Deliver datasets to support data-driven features
Work on core product areas: search, homepage, filters, and map experience
Contribute to projects exploring AI tools, including AI-powered search features
Focused on improving product and user experience




Essential Skills:

Strong attitude and willingness to learn
Experience with R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, BigQuery
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience with A/B testing
Exposure to consumer-facing apps
Comfortable working with B2B tech products
At least 2 years of Data Analyst experience (open to more experience)




Benefits:

Personalized coaching, free online learning courses, and access to a fully equipped campus library
Relocation and visa support for Germany
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours
Daily canteen lunch, free drinks, and snacks
Health insurance, pension plan
Free on-campus gym and much more!




If you are interested and fit the bill, please apply today as we are scheduling interviews immediately.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Business Intelligence Consultant willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa - must live in Portugal - mandatory).




Are you the one?




Design data schemas, modeling data structures and perform data migrations.
Design high-performance data pipelines & ETL processes.
Business Intelligence Professional – Key Qualifications.
Minimum of 3 years of experience with SQL.
Hands-on experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Proficient in Power BI (DAX) for data visualization and reporting.
Preferred knowledge of Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Python.
Strong interest and enthusiasm for consultancy work.




We believe we are the ones to, by:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh… and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar;
At least 2 years as a data analyst
Experience with Python, PySpark and airflow;
Comfortable with Oracle DB, Data warehouse;
Fluent in English;
Good communication and interpersonal skills;
Be already in Portugal legally, available to do a hybrid model in Lisbon.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been electedWe believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.




At KCS IT, we stand for equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with the required skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Quienes somos: Randstad Digital somos la empresa de consultoría tecnológica del grupo Randstad especializada en servicios tecnológicos estables. A nivel global estamos presente en más de 20 paises y contamos con más de 25.000 especialistas IT y a nivel nacional con más de 400 y tenemos oficinas en Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Sevilla, Zaragoza, Bilbao y Valladolid.

Llevamos a cabo servicios de IT e ingeniería apasionantes y con las últimas tecnologías. Cuidamos de nuestr@s trabajadores mediante el trato humano que nos caracteriza y por ello te impulsamos para seguir creciendo sin límites!




Nuestro objetivo: Crecer e impulsar junt@s en equipo el liderazgo digital para innovar y marcar la diferencia basándonos en la responsabilidad social tecnológica, conectando personas y tecnología.

Tus funciones: Si tu trayectoria profesional está orientada al desarrollo de aplicaciones java y cuentas con una sólida experiencia profesional ¡Queremos conocerte!




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Diseñar y desarrollar paneles en Power BI basados en los requisitos de los usuarios, asegurando precisión, relevancia y claridad visual.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de UX/UI para garantizar un diseño intuitivo y fácil de usar en todas las visualizaciones.
Coordinar y facilitar la entrega de los objetivos del proyecto, asegurando alineación con los plazos, expectativas de los interesados y metas comerciales.




Requisitos del puesto: Si te ves reflejad@, te animamos a asumir este reto.




3 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI. Experiencia demostrada en la creación de paneles, informes y visualizaciones de datos a nivel empresarial.
Experiencia en diseño UX/UI con enfoque en usabilidad, coherencia y alineación con la marca.
Gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicarse eficazmente con los interesados del negocio.
Se requiere certificación PL-300




VALORABLE: Conocimiento de Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Direct Lake, Dataflows Gen2) y certificación DP-600.




Tus beneficios: ¿A qué esperas para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo Randstad Digital?, aquí encontrarás motivos para ello:

PLAN DE FORMACIÓN CONTINUA, plan de formación anual, acceso a plataforma elearning de formación técnica, plataforma de formación en habilidades...
ACOMPAÑAMIENTO Y PLAN DE CARRERA, Tendrás un referente de Randstad Digital cerca de ti en todo momento.
CONCILIACIÓN, Sabemos que tu vida personal es tan importante como la profesional por eso podrás disfrutar de 23 días de vacaciones y en la mayoría de nuestros proyectos tendrás un horario flexible.
COMPROMISO y ESTABILIDAD, Incorporación a empresa en continuo crecimiento que apuesta por las nuevas tecnologías.
SALARIO COMPETITIVO acorde a tu experiencia profesional.
CONDICIONES contractuales competitivas, Plan de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante y cheques guardería) y Randstad Care, plataforma de ofertas y descuentos exclusivos.
PLAN TRÁETE UN AMIG@, si nos ayudas a incrementar el equipo, te premiaremos con una compensación económica.

Se garantiza la confidencialidad en el proceso de selección.

¿Tienes ganas y te ves preparado/a para asumir un nuevo reto como el nuestro?

¡Te estamos esperando! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJVLc3JtdsA

#somosRSC Randstad promueve la equidad de oportunidades laborales

a través de equipos diversos e inclusivos. Por ello, en nuestros

procesos, garantizamos la inserción de todas las personas

independientemente de su condición personal, género, orientación

sexual, etnia, cultura, edad, religión o discapacidad.

#somosRSC Randstad promueve la equidad de oportunidades laborales

a través de equipos diversos e inclusivos. Por ello, en nuestros

procesos, garantizamos la inserción de todas las personas

independientemente de su condición personal, género, orientación

sexual, etnia, cultura, edad, religión o discapacidad.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Sector: Fintech

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: €55,000 – €60,000 plus bonus, health and pension




Our Client

Our client is a Fintech with a strong international footprint and a reputation for delivering intelligent data solutions across the financial services sector. With a focus on innovation, cross-functional collaboration, and operational excellence, they are continually investing in their people and platforms to stay ahead of evolving market demands.




Why should you apply?

This opportunity offers the chance to join a high-performing data team at a critical time of platform enhancement and modernisation. The successful candidate will play a central role in developing high-impact datasets and dashboards that support strategic decision-making. You will gain exposure to leading-edge cloud technologies in a role that balances technical depth with business engagement. The company also promotes flexible work arrangements, excellent learning and development pathways, and a highly supportive team environment.




Who should apply?

This role is ideal for an experienced data professional looking to deepen their analytics expertise in a commercially impactful environment:

At least 3 years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
Proficient with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong SQL skills and exposure to Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with cloud-based data warehousing tools is advantageous.
Able to interpret data meaningfully and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.
Analytical thinker with strong organisational and prioritisation skills.




Role and Reporting Lines

You will report to a senior data leader within a structured analytics function that collaborates across business units. Core responsibilities will include:

Data Architecture – Assist in the design and maintenance of core datasets to support analytics needs.
Visualisation – Create clear, insightful dashboards and performance reports for various teams.
Insight Delivery – Identify trends and deliver actionable insights that guide business strategies.
Data Quality – Support the development of data quality frameworks and conduct regular audits.
Cross-functional Collaboration – Liaise with technology and operations teams to refine data sources and ensure alignment with business goals.
Best Practice – Contribute to the adoption of industry-leading analytics standards.
Training – Educate internal users on data literacy and the use of reporting tools.
Documentation – Maintain structured guidance on processes, governance, and technical configurations.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below.

Title: Data Analytics and Insights Analyst
Description:
DATA INSIGHTS and ANALYTICS ANALYST




PURPOSE OF THE JOB:




• Support with data and insights, align inputs to the Segmented Execution use case (products OOS, overstock, key challenges/opportunities)

• Support Data Analytics & AI Manager and colleagues on delivering updates and organizing communications to end users with involved stakeholders (mainly sales & TM)

• Reporting and Data Visualization & Dashboarding for cases (PowerBI based reports)

• Support data inventory and data managements processes (coordinating and archiving data mapping activities)

• Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)




SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:




• Management of data sources

• Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

• Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

• Ability to use and communicate data

• Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

• IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

• Analytical mindset

• Experience in analytics related departments

• Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

• MS Office – deep knowledge and experience




EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:




1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus




WHERE WILL YOU WORK




Sesto San Giovanni (MI)




DISCOVER WHO WE ARE




Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.




We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondovì, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.




Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.




Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.




AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY




At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.




Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Scandit FINLAND




Imagine the what. Build the how.
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.




Your opportunity




As a Data Analyst in the Data Team, you will turn data into insights and support product managers, engineering teams, and other key stakeholders in decision-making based on data. You will also be heavily involved in the ShelfView product operations process as well as team internal reporting, KPI tracking, and data processing.





Analyse data and create visualizations in dashboards


Ingest, clean, and enhance static datasets like product catalogs


Drive on-off data handling needs and help to automate repetitive processes


Collaborate with other teams to turn data into knowledge and understanding





Who we look for





Degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field


2-3 years of work experience in Data Analysis.


Experience using Python to read, modify, and enhance data and use APIs to access production data


Curious mindset to explore hidden insights and work hands-on with data


Ability to start from a question and develop answers based on data


Familiarity with SQL queries, databases, and visualization tools (Looker Studio, PowerBI)


Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


Eligible to work in Poland or Finland





The good stuff
Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their careers at Scandit: 





An attractive individual equity plan in a high-growth company 


Smart, people-first culture


Flexible, office, hybrid, or home working


Innovation hackathons 


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Mentoring programs


Top-notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





 




We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in Switzerland, the UK, the USA, Poland, France and Italy and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK 




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. 




 




Imagine the What. Build the How.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed.




We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Fenergo, our aim is to future-proof Client Lifecyle Management through our award-winning SaaS based solutions that empower financial institutions. With the expertise of our 700 employees across 11 offices worldwide we enable our clients to improve operational efficiencies and return on investment, manage compliance with KYC, AML and reduce risk with continuous monitoring of clients and transactions throughout the client lifecycle.

Fenergo dynamically manages any client type, any product type and every client journey for all segments, channels and devices.

As a company we value collaboration with cross functional teams, driving employee engagement and are champions of diversity and inclusion. As we continue to grow and evolve, we look for team members who will make a meaningful impact, contribute to a positive work environment and shape the future of our organisation.

Join us as we build a workplace where talent thrives and together, we achieve new heights of success!

Requirements

What Will You Do?

You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining key dataset and models across the organisation which are driven from our cloud-based data lake infrastructure on AWS. You will work closely with a ringfenced team of system engineers, data analysts and a delivery manager to implement best practices for data management and contribute to the overall success of our data platform. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic individual with a strong analytical background who is passionate about working on innovative data projects.

Responsibilities:


Collect, process and analyse data to derive insights and inform business decisions
Develop and maintain datasets and data models
Create visualizations and reports to present findings to stakeholders
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data
Collaborate with teams to define data requirements and goals
Ensure data quality and integrity
Stay current on industry best practices and data analysis techniques
Utilize statistical and analytical tools to interpret data
Monitor and maintain data quality through regular audits and assessments
Collaborate with data governance teams to establish data quality policies
Create and maintain data quality documentation
Train and educate employees on data quality best practices
Perform data profiling and analysis to identify potential data quality problems
Utilize data quality tools and technologies to improve data accuracy and consistency



Expectations


3+ years in a Data Analytics role
You have good experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
You have strong critical thinking skills and ability to analyse complex datasets
You are proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python or R, middleware solutions such as Workato and have some experience with Snowflake, DBT or Redshift
You are a storyteller, who can communicate your insights to your team and cross functionally
You are great at prioritising, you know when to say yes and equally importantly, you know when to say no and you do that the right way
You are curious, asking great questions, looking to always improve how we work and how you can grow professionally and personally



Our Promise To You

We are striving to become global leaders across all of the categories we operate in and as part of that we are a high-performing highly collaborative team that works cross functionally to accommodate our clients needs.

What we value is at the CORE of how we succeed:


Collaboration: Working together to achieve our best
Outcomes: Drive Success in every engagement
Respect: A collective feeling of inclusion and belonging
Excellence: Continuously raising the bar



Benefits


Healthcare cover through the VHI
Company pension contribution
Life assurance/ Income protection
23 days annual leave
3 company days
Annual bonus opportunity
Work From Home set-up allowance
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale for a world leader in Client Lifecycle Management
Other competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programs, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University'
Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress.
Active sports and social club
State of the art offices in the heart of Dublin's Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area



Diversity, Equality, and Inclusivity

Fenergo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all employees are valued, respected, and can reach their full potential. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We believe that a diverse workforce enriches our company culture, fosters innovation, and contributes to our overall success. We strive to provide a fair and supportive environment for all employees, promoting equal opportunities for career development and advancement. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment opportunities and join our team in contributing to a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 4 anos de experiência em funções de Data Analyst;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de PowerBI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Business Insights

Dublin, Ireland or United States

6 months contract to hire




Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate Data Analyst to explore, analyze, report, and action on data from our portfolio of sports titles. We’re looking for someone who can translate product & business knowledge into deep analysis and, in turn, translate to actionable insights for cross functional business stakeholders. As you deliver valuable insights to stakeholders, you will aim to build strong relationships, become a trusted partner among business functions, and scale out team efforts from one team to the next. Our mission is to enable our partners to be more proactive, productive & successful by providing best in class, end-to-end and scalable data solutions.




The ideal candidate for this role has the ability to see the underlying story in the data and know how to ask the right questions. A solution-oriented and creative problem solver. A self-starter with the passion and enthusiasm to join a growing insights team to get results for meaningful change.




Job Responsibilities:

Leverage a deep understanding of how our titles’ game features & mechanics work and our business priorities to deliver actionable, business-impacting insights
Support business narratives and develop business cases, with effective data storytelling. Focus on using data and hypothesis driven decision-making to drive future growth and customer lifetime value
Learn different business teams’ and stakeholders’ ways of working and preferences for understanding data and be a bridge between the data team and business teams (Product, Marketing, Commercial) to translate complex business needs into data-related projects
Flexibly deliver different types of output to match stakeholder needs, including reports, visualizations, charts, and tables
Gain an understanding of internal titles outside of our portfolio to provide strong benchmarking and comparison points for business performance
Drive the exploration of creative new ways of measurement to identify patterns and causal relationships
Empower teams to track and analyze activity/productivity and support their research projects leading the efforts towards building scalable self-service tools
Data doesn't just appear overnight; we work with our stakeholders to understand what data matters most to their business and strategy. In addition to delivering insights on what is available to us, this role will be responsible for liaising with stakeholders to proactively identify what data we need to begin to record for future initiatives that drive value




Qualifications:

Track record of successfully delivering insights and analysis across business functions (Product, Commercial, Marketing)
Video games experience & passion - particularly in sports titles
Profound experience in data modeling
Profound knowledge in SQL and a data science language, such as Python or R
Great communication skills and a clear understanding of how to make insights understandable and actionable
High degree of proactiveness and curiosity to understand, measure and improve business operations through data
Ability to set a clear focus on priorities and execute on them effectively
Understanding internal customer satisfaction as one of your key success factors
Experience in data visualization tools, such as Tableau
Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst - Business Insights

Dublin, Ireland or United States

6 months contract to hire


Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate Data Analyst to explore, analyze, report, and action on data from our portfolio of sports titles. We’re looking for someone who can translate product & business knowledge into deep analysis and, in turn, translate to actionable insights for cross functional business stakeholders. As you deliver valuable insights to stakeholders, you will aim to build strong relationships, become a trusted partner among business functions, and scale out team efforts from one team to the next. Our mission is to enable our partners to be more proactive, productive & successful by providing best in class, end-to-end and scalable data solutions.


The ideal candidate for this role has the ability to see the underlying story in the data and know how to ask the right questions. A solution-oriented and creative problem solver. A self-starter with the passion and enthusiasm to join a growing insights team to get results for meaningful change.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Leverage a deep understanding of how our titles’ game features & mechanics work and our business priorities to deliver actionable, business-impacting insights
  • Support business narratives and develop business cases, with effective data storytelling. Focus on using data and hypothesis driven decision-making to drive future growth and customer lifetime value
  • Learn different business teams’ and stakeholders’ ways of working and preferences for understanding data and be a bridge between the data team and business teams (Product, Marketing, Commercial) to translate complex business needs into data-related projects
  • Flexibly deliver different types of output to match stakeholder needs, including reports, visualizations, charts, and tables
  • Gain an understanding of internal titles outside of our portfolio to provide strong benchmarking and comparison points for business performance
  • Drive the exploration of creative new ways of measurement to identify patterns and causal relationships
  • Empower teams to track and analyze activity/productivity and support their research projects leading the efforts towards building scalable self-service tools
  • Data doesn't just appear overnight; we work with our stakeholders to understand what data matters most to their business and strategy. In addition to delivering insights on what is available to us, this role will be responsible for liaising with stakeholders to proactively identify what data we need to begin to record for future initiatives that drive value


Qualifications:

  • Track record of successfully delivering insights and analysis across business functions (Product, Commercial, Marketing)
  • Video games experience & passion - particularly in sports titles
  • Profound experience in data modeling
  • Profound knowledge in SQL and a data science language, such as Python or R
  • Great communication skills and a clear understanding of how to make insights understandable and actionable
  • High degree of proactiveness and curiosity to understand, measure and improve business operations through data
  • Ability to set a clear focus on priorities and execute on them effectively
  • Understanding internal customer satisfaction as one of your key success factors
  • Experience in data visualization tools, such as Tableau

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

As a company at the forefront of digital transformation in financial institutions, Fenergo is revolutionizing the way client and regulatory technology is utilized in the industry. With a focus on providing Client Lifecycle Management (CLM) software solutions, Fenergo empowers financial institutions to deliver a faster, compliant, and digital customer experience.

With over 700 employees across 11 offices worldwide, Fenergo is a truly global company. This presents a unique opportunity for individuals who are ambitious and eager to make a significant impact in the financial services industry. Fenergo's impressive track record is reflected in their numerous accolades, including being recognized as the No. 1 CLM provider in RiskTech100™ and the winner of the Deloitte Best Managed Companies award. Furthermore, Fenergo's CEO, Marc Murphy, emphasizes the company's commitment to innovation and growth, making it an exciting place for talented individuals to contribute their skills and showcase their abilities.

What Will You Do?

You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining key dataset and models across the organisation which are driven from our cloud-based data lake infrastructure on AWS. You will work closely with a ringfenced team of system engineers, data analysts and a delivery manager to implement best practices for data management and contribute to the overall success of our data platform. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic individual with a strong analytical background who is passionate about working on innovative data projects.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and analysing data from various sources
Support the creation of reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau
Demonstrate a strong willingness to develop technical and analytical skills on the job
Work with senior analysts to identify trends and generate actionable insights
Ensure accuracy in data collection, cleaning, and reporting tasks
Learn and apply SQL and Python for basic data analysis tasks
Clearly present simple insights and summaries to team members or stakeholders



Skills & Qualifications:


0-2 years of experience in a data-related role or internship
Familiarity with data tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or SQL
Strong attention to detail and a willingness to learn
Good communication and collaboration skills
A degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science)



Our promise to you

We are striving to become global leaders across all of the categories we operate in and as part of that we are a high-performing highly collaborative team that works cross functionally to accommodate our clients needs.

What we value is at the CORE of how we succeed:


Collaboration: Working together to achieve our best
Outcomes: Drive Success in every engagement
Respect: A collective feeling of inclusion and belonging
Excellence: Continuously raising the bar



Benefits

What's in it for you?


Healthcare cover through the VHI
Company pension contribution
Life assurance/ Income protection
23 days annual leave
3 company days
Annual bonus opportunity
Work From Home set-up allowance
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale for a world leader in Client Lifecycle Management
Other competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programs, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University'
Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress
Active sports and social club
State of the art offices in the heart of Dublin's Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area



Diversity, Equality, and Inclusivity

Fenergo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all employees are valued, respected, and can reach their full potential. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We believe that a diverse workforce enriches our company culture, fosters innovation, and contributes to our overall success. We strive to provide a fair and supportive environment for all employees, promoting equal opportunities for career development and advancement. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment opportunities and join our team in contributing to a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.




Your Contribution:

Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.




Your Skills:

2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Experience with SQL.
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Azerion

Azerion was founded in 2013 and is a technology company providing digital advertising and online gaming services headquartered in the Netherlands. Azerion operates a proprietary digital advertising platform focusing on both gaming and general (nongaming) content.

In recent years Azerion Group has expanded along the user engagement value chain to become a full stack provider of online digital advertising services, connecting advertisers with audiences through digital content (owned and third party) providers globally. The Group is involved in the provision of content-driven technology and data, serving consumers, advertisers, digital publishers, and game creators globally.

Our mission is to be the go-to-partner for advertisers for an easy to-use, competitively priced, brand-safe digital environment.

We are headquartered in Amsterdam and we have more than 1100 talented people of 55 nationalities working in 24 offices around Europe, with very diverse and multi-ethnic backgrounds.

For our Business Intelligence team at Azerion Head Quarters in Amsterdam we are looking for an Intern Data Analyst.

Team

The Business Intelligence team is an international, growing team within Azerion, with the mission of providing useful and actionable insights to our gaming/advertising products.

From importing the data, to processing it, analyzing it and exposing it to the users, we cover the whole data flow. Huge volumes of data, multiple sources and different analysis techniques are their own bread and butter.

We all are data enthusiasts with passion for our work, if that’s your dream job too, this is your chance!

What you will be doing and learning

The Data Analyst intern will work with gaming/advertising related data, with the main goal of deriving useful insights in order to enhance our products portfolio performance.

He/she will be collaborating with the other Data Analysts and with the Product Owners of the different products in the Azerion portfolio. No matter if it’s a casual or social game, mobile or desktop advertisement, there is always something hidden to find in our data.

Every day there is always a chance to learn something new while having fun!

Your Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Understanding stakeholder’s requirements and translating them into actionable reports/analysis
Communicating with live operations team / POs in order to assist them in making data driven decisions and adjusting their product update and promotion strategy
Taking an active role in the daily operations, responding to report performance and delivery issues
Developing both regular and ad-hoc reports
Maintaining, troubleshooting, and resolving issues/questions for report inventory
Supporting report environment best practices, coding standards, and look-and-feel
...and most important...having fun with data!


What you are able to bring to the table


Passion for the gaming/advertising industry
Passion for data
Strong analytical thinking and ability to solve problems
Proactive self-learner, able to adapt quickly to new technologies and solutions
Team and independent worker
Ability to work in a fast paced and active environment with evolving priorities
Ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences


What We Offer You


The opportunity to work and learn at an innovative, high-paced company located near Amsterdam
An informal yet professional international working environment
Room for personal development in a highly skilled and motivated team
Hybrid work
Internship fee of €400,- per month
Lunch is provided for free
Weekly optional workout programs like kick boxing


Does this sound like that great internship you’re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form and attach your CV.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at

recruitment@azerion.com

Here’s what happens after you send your application

You’ll receive an email confirming our hiring department has received your application. An update will follow as to what the next stage will be for you.
